result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Wiemer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine and costs, balance to be paid in 90 days or serve 11 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M Wiemer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian M Wiemer in court with attorney Daniel McMurray for Jess Martinez.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $515.00  (apply cash bail and balance to be paid in 90 days or serve 11 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment of fine. )
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid in 90 days)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Brian M Wiemer in court with attorney Dan McMurray for Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney McMurray has received discovery and an offer and is requesting additional time for negotiations.   The Court sets the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian M Wiemer in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant requests additional time to retain counsel.  The Defendant has received an offer.  The Court instructs the Defendant to apply at the public defender's office and return back to Court.  The case is recalled and the Defendant advises the Court he does qualify for representation by the public defender's office and an attorney will be appointed.
Defendant to have no contact with  victim/witness/Whitman Park Shopping Center listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Brian M Wiemer in court.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Brian M Wiemer not in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
